value:
By the end of 2016’s boom in global takeover activity, the value of M&A totaled $3.6 trillion, making it the second-best year (after 2015) for dealmakers since the financial crisis. Listen as the leading market participants share their M&A outlook for 2017, including the impact current tax reform proposals will have on M&A, whether European companies will seek growth abroad, and the impact the new administration will have on cross-border M&A.

Moderator:
Kate Kelly, Reporter, New York Times

Speakers:
John Huwiler, Managing Director, Global Head of M&A, Jefferies
Leon Kalvaria, Chairman, Institutional Clients Group, Citi
Steve Krouskos, Global Vice Chair, Transaction Advisory Services, EY
Virginie Morgon, Deputy CEO, Eurazeo; President and CEO, Eurazeo North America
Greg Weinberger, Co-Head of Global Mergers and Acquisitions, Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC
